column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.3
#T_SP=custom.Span|label
#T_RL=custom.Relation|label|BT_custom.Span
#Text=From common joy; which with the speechless feeling
#Text=That led her there united, and shot forth
#Text=From her far eyes a light of deep revealing,
#Text=All but her dearest self from my regard concealing.
#Text=Her lips were parted, and the measured breath
#Text=Was now heard there; her dark and intricate eyes
#Text=Orb within orb, deeper than sleep or death,
#Text=Absorbed the glories of the burning skies,
#Text=Which, mingling with her heart's deep ecstasies,
#Text=Burst from her looks and gestures; and a light
#Text=Of liquid tenderness, like love, did rise
#Text=From her whole frame, an atmosphere which quite
#Text=Arrayed her in its beams, tremulous and soft and bright.
#Text=She would have clasped me to her glowing frame;
#Text=Those warm and odorous lips might soon have shed
#Text=On mine the fragrance and the invisible flame
#Text=Which now the cold winds stole; she would have laid
#Text=Upon my languid heart her dearest head;
#Text=I might have heard her voice, tender and sweet;
#Text=Her eyes, mingling with mine, might soon have fed
#Text=My soul with their own joy.
#Text=—One moment yet
#Text=I gazed—we parted then, never again to meet!
#Text=Never but once to meet on Earth again!
#Text=She heard me as I fled—her eager tone
#Text=Sunk on my heart, and almost wove a chain
#Text=Around my will to link it with her own,
#Text=So that my stern resolve was almost gone.
#Text='I cannot reach thee!
#Text=whither dost thou fly?
#Text=My steps are faint—Come back, thou dearest one—
#Text=Return, ah me!
#Text=return!
#Text=' —The wind passed by
#Text=On which those accents died, faint, far, and lingeringly.
#Text=Woe!
#Text=Woe!
#Text=that moonless midnight!
#Text=—Want and Pest
#Text=Were horrible, but one more fell doth rear,
#Text=As in a hydra ' s swarming lair, its crest
#Text=Eminent among those victims—even the Fear
#Text=Of Hell: each girt by the hot atmosphere
#Text=Of his blind agony, like a scorpion stung
#Text=By his own rage upon his burning bier
#Text=Of circling coals of fire; but still there clung
#Text=   One hope, like a keen sword on starting threads uphung
